Key Match Events: The Phillies rallied with back-to-back doubles by Kody Clemens and Cal Stevenson followed by a Buddy Kennedy single to seal a 9-4 win.
Kyle Schwarber exited the game with a hyperextended elbow.
Edwin Uceta, a Tampa Bay Rays reliever, hit Nick Castellanos with a pitch, leading to benches clearing.
Bryce Harper was enraged and approached the mound before being restrained by Tampa Bay players.
Uceta was ejected by the umpires.
Trea Turner hit two home runs in the game.
Post-Match Reflections: Bryce Harper expressed his frustration over the incident with Edwin Uceta, stating it was not acceptable in Major League Baseball.
Kyle Schwarber criticized the decision to leave Uceta in the game, suggesting it led to the incident.
Harper reflected on the team's close-knit nature and their understanding of their goals.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Phillies' magic number to clinch their first division title in 13 years is 10.
Ranger Suárez allowed 12 hits in 5 1/3 innings, raising concerns about his readiness for October.
Bryce Harper has not homered in 28 games, the second-longest drought of his career, but is hitting well otherwise.
Uceta's 96.2 mph pitch that hit Castellanos was the fastest pitch he has thrown all season.
